{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3334670,"name":"","username":"Mateo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/f4b2a3/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-16T21:39:05.890Z","cooked":"

I am trying to get the robot to follow a path drawn on a tablet. I developed a very simple android app that gets the x and y coordinates of a screen touch and translates them to field coordinates, and i wrote some simple java code that checks serial ports and un-encodes the data into x and y coords, but i have no clue where to go from here. i know that i want to use pathplanner if possible, but i am just lost on where to go

Check pathplanner lib. there is a path making on the fly option that can make a path based on the list of coordinates you provide it with.

// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of
// the WPILib BSD license file in the root directory of this project.

package frc.robot.auto;

import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d;
import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Rotation2d;
import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Translation2d;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command;
import java.util.List;

import com.pathplanner.lib.path.GoalEndState;
import com.pathplanner.lib.path.PathConstraints;
import com.pathplanner.lib.path.PathPlannerPath;

public class TabletFollow extends Command {
/** Creates a new TabletFollow. */
int x;
int y;

public TabletFollow() {
// Use addRequirements() here to declare subsystem dependencies.
}

// Called when the command is initially scheduled.
@Override
public void initialize() {}

// Called every time the scheduler runs while the command is scheduled.
@Override
public void execute() {
x = SerialPortListener.xValue;
y = SerialPortListener.yValue;

List<Translation2d> bezierPoints = PathPlannerPath.bezierFromPoses(
    new Pose2d(x, y, Rotation2d.fromDegrees(0))
);

PathPlannerPath path = new PathPlannerPath(
    bezierPoints,
    new PathConstraints(3.0, 3.0, 2 * Math.PI, 4 * Math.PI), // The constraints for this path. If using a differential drivetrain, the angular constraints have no effect.
    new GoalEndState(0.0, Rotation2d.fromDegrees(0)) // Goal end state. You can set a holonomic rotation here. If using a differential drivetrain, the rotation will have no effect.
);

path.preventFlipping =true;

}

// Called once the command ends or is interrupted.
@Override
public void end(boolean interrupted) {}

// Returns true when the command should end.
@Override
public boolean isFinished() {
return false;
}
}

this is the furthest i’ve gotten

It is a command. Return a command

return autobuilder.followpath(path);

Also I would not suggest bezier from points. Use pathfinder to target. Look at docs. Bezier will try to just go straight there regardless of what is in front of it. Sorry for the late response, I have had a busy week with competition and a lot of homework to do as well.
